work.name: DataWorks Plus
work.summary: In my first summer here, I contributed to the development team by implementing front end web pages, backend services (to accompany front end pages as well as other server side requirements), building a relational database using Entity Framework Core and MySQL, and implementing a solution to periodically (as well as manually) invalidate the site's cache to ensure updated content is pushed to users

work.name: DataWorks Plus
work.summary: In my second summer here, I spent the entirety of my time researching, testing, and integrating a distributed caching system into an existing web application. This was done to limit the number of requests to the server and improve overall site response time.

projects.name: Good Driver Incentive Program
projects.summary: As part of a semester long group project, I was able to participate in a mock iteration of the software development lifecycle using Agile processes. We analyzed, designed, and deployed a full stack web application using Microsoft's .NET and C#. The focus of the project required us to enable mock companies to reward commercial truck through a cloud based portal. Click the link above to be taken to the GitHub repository where this is stored.

projects.name: Pizzeria Management System
projects.summary: For this project, I designed and implemented a MySQL database to track the day-to-day operations of a mock pizzeria. To accompany the database, I developed a Java application to allow users to interact with the database using a command line interface. Click the link above to be taken to the GitHub repository where this is stored.
